page.title: 19Cowtons' Local History
page.content: Our local claim to fame is the Battle of Cowton Moor, when the Scots were defeated by the English in 1138. Scots Graves is a field named after this battle. St Marys Church at South Cowton and Cowton Castle were built by Sir Richard Conyers between 1450-1460. All Saints Church at East Cowton was built in 1910 to replace the old St Marys, which was finally demolished in the late 1960's. The land is now used as a cemetary. Pepper Arden Hall was the home of Sir Cuthbert Pepper, who died in 1608. His decendant married an Arden, hence the name. The Knights Templars built Temple House near East Cowton in 1142. A large boulder at Town End Farm in N Cowton is a relic of the Ice Age. Both village schools were built over 100 years ago. N Cowton's is still used, the other is being converted.
